definition[0]: not limited by or depending on any conditions
example[0]: the unconditional release of all political prisoners
definition[1]: a takeover offer which does not depend on any conditions
example[2]: The group announced that it made a formal unconditional bid to the board offering to buy 160,000 shares.
definition[2]: if a takeover offer goes or becomes unconditional, it is accepted by more than half the existing shareholders
example[3]: Once the offer document is posted, a takeover offer can become unconditional within four weeks.
